body: Valid bug, thanks for reporting. It happens because your github account doesn't have a full name assigned. I'm not sure, though, how `User.Smart.name()` method should behave in this situation.
@yegor256 yes, will do right away! hey @longtimeago, many thanks, I just added **15 mins** to your account, payment ID is `DA2084431`
The cost of this task is **30 mins** (this is exactly how much will be paid, not less not more), when the task is done
@longtimeago this ticket is yours now, please proceed, and keep in mind [this](http://www.tpc2.com/dev/intro). Any technical questions you should ask right here
and how `User.Smart.name()` should behave in case of account doesn't have a full name assigned?

Let's:
1. throw a custom exception with a proper message
2. introduce a new method `User.Smart.hasName()`

Make sense?

@yegor256 I've implemented method `User.Smart.hasName()` But I don't understand were should we use it.
1) Should we use it in `User.Smart.name()`?
2) Should we use it in `RtIssueITCase.talksInGithubProject()`

Please, provide more details about desired behavior of `User.Smart.name()`

We'll just make it public and let people use it. And when `name()` is called and user doesn't have a name we throw a runtime exception with the message "user logntimeago doesn't have a name specified in his/her Github account, use hasName() first". That's it
